project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
* Pool/Backlog data will now return as part of the payload a list of projects contained in the issues. This data will be expanded upon in the future.
* This story will incorporate GHS-5217
* In the case where no issues are found in a backlog/pool, we determine recent projects by the query of the board
** If the query is not project-based, then we do not modify the project history
* Be smart about where projects get inserted into the history
* When viewing a Rapid Board via a gadget, this should not have an effect on the recent projects for the user


To be smart about history, consider the following example.

Viewing a board with issues from projects A, B, X and Y.

The issues are seen by the board (ordered by Rank), in the order X, A, B, Y.

The user's current history contains the projects in the following order (most recent first): D, B, A, F, G.

Because we do not want to upset the order of projects that were already in the history and that we have just seen, the desired new ordering of projects is as follows:
B, A, X, Y, D, F, G.
fields.summary: When a Rapid Board is shown, add the projects shown in issues to the most recently used list in JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The new Sprint field used by the Rapid board, separate from the Fix For Version, is great. 

However right now a big flaw with using it is that there is no convenient way to set it directly from the Edit Issue view (as opposed to using the Plan tab UI of the Rapid Board). This is often necessary - say there is a critical bug that needs to be filed and added to the current sprint, it would be nice to do it in a single shot rather than having to create it, find it on the rapid board and drag it into the sprint.

You can add the Sprint field to the Default issue screen, which makes it appear when Editing the issue, but this shows a text field where you have to enter the ID of the sprint. Since this is a system-level value that no user would ever know, its less than useful to non-power users. 

The ideal would be to enable the use of either a Select dropdown or an autocomplete-type editor a la fix for versions. I suspect this shouldn't be too hard to do, just allow the Autocomplete/Select renderer for the Sprint field.

If there is any workaround to get this working before it's released (say some sample plugin code) that could be posted this would be great.
fields.summary: Enable Select or Autocomplete Renderer for new Greenhopper Sprint field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For users getting started with GreenHopper and JIRA, it would be handy to allow them to create a new workflow as they define the columns of their Rapid Board, rather than have to create the workflow in advance. 

This would make it super quick and easy to get started using GH and JIRA, and avoid the more daunting aspects of workflow management. 

The more we can do intelligently behind the scenes, the better. Prompt to ask questions, like "You've tried to transition this issue to a workflow state that doen't have a transition defined - would you like to create one?"
fields.summary: Configure JIRA workflow by setting up Rapid Board columns

fields.description:
I've had a couple of instances where I would create an issue (a task in the planning board in the latest case).  Then I switch to the task board and drag and drop the issue from open to in progress swim lane.  After the drop event the board spins continuously and all JIRA pages become unresponsive.  It seems to create some deadlock on the server side and requests from even new browsers are unresponsive.

I see the following in the logs prior to this occurrence:
ERROR ... /secure/GHAddIssue.jspa [velocity] RHS of #set statement is null. Context will not be modified. templates/greenhopper/jira/issue/fields/ranking-field.vm [line 12, column 1]
fields.summary: JIRA hangs when assigning task to in progress status in the task board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the GreenHopper Rapid Board the systems shows an empty screen with a message:
{code}
Error
'00000000000005.000' is an invalid number
{code}

The given number changes depending on the project:
{code}
Error
'00000000000013.000' is an invalid number. 
{code}

Caused by:
Rendering of values now follows user locale. German locale differs from Swiss and English locale in that it uses comma instead of dot for decimal values.

Workaround:
Change the user's locale back to English to keep the Rapid Board working
fields.summary: Unable Access Rapid Board if Story Point is Edited/Set in German(Germany) Language.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The two cases which are considered "misconfiguration":

* The Sprint field is not a *Global* custom field (i.e. it is not mapped to all projects and all issue types)
* The Sprint field is *Hidden* in some *Field Configuration Scheme*

You will see this in the logs:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: it doesn't make sense to have a field that is neither indexed nor stored
at org.apache.lucene.document.Field.<init>(Field.java:400)
at org.apache.lucene.document.Field.<init>(Field.java:371)
at org.apache.lucene.document.Field.<init>(Field.java:350)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintCustomFieldIndexer.addDocumentFields(SprintCustomFieldIndexer.java:61)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintCustomFieldIndexer.addDocumentFieldsNotSearchable(SprintCustomFieldIndexer.java:34)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.indexers.impl.AbstractCustomFieldIndexer.addIndex(AbstractCustomFieldIndexer.java:50)
{noformat}

{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 

The following KB article has been written up as a work around to this issue please go here to view it [Indexing error: It doesn't make sense to have a field that is neither indexed nor stored|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Indexing+error%3A+It+doesn%27t+make+sense+to+have+a+field+that+is+neither+indexed+nor+stored]
It is recommended to upgrade GreenHopper off 5.9.7 and then follow the guide in the KB to ensure that the rapid boards are showing.
{panel}
fields.summary: If Sprint field is misconfigured then reindex of issues will blow up

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
User would like to abort / cancel a Sprint and remove all history of the Sprint (including from issues tagged in that Sprint)

 Unable to completely remove a sprint, as well delete history records from a related issue(s).
 For further details and to reproduce the error, please follow the procedures below:

# Create a new project and raise new issues on it.
# In the GH global settings, enable the project and select Scrum in template and for Rapid Board
# Set a new Rapid Board to related project
# Create a Sprint and move the previous issue(s) to it.
# Try to find a version in the project (none)
# Check on planning board, no sprint.
# On the issue(s) screen, identify the "Agile" option value (sprint version).
# Delete the Rapid Board created.

The issues will keep the sprint value.
[Here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-38120] we have a related issue.

Kindly regards,

Paulo Renato
Atlassian support
fields.summary: As a user I would like to completely cancel / abort a Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am testing Jira 5 and GH before upgrading our production server and whenever I access Planning Board Jira hangs for up to 20seconds. Looking at the server I see that the CPU is maxed out during this period. All other Jira functionalities with 5.0 appear as with the previous version. This issue is blocking me from promoting this version to production :(

I asked my IT team to review this and they say the test Jira appears to only use 1 CPU from a multi CPU setup. Could this the cause? 

See top output from when clicking on planning board where the test environment is only using 48%.
Prod
{panel}
Tasks: 154 total,   1 running, 153 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s): 78.0%us,  9.3%sy,  0.0%ni, 12.1%id,  0.2%wa,  0.2%hi,  0.3%si,  0.0%st
Mem:   8175456k total,  8119284k used,    56172k free,   239896k buffers

{panel}

fields.description:
According to GreenHopper release note - 
bq. The Global Rank field allows ranking by users that have the Schedule Issues permission. There is no longer an option to use the Resolve Issue permission for ranking. 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.8+Upgrade+Notes#GreenHopper58UpgradeNotes-ChangestoRanking

Please update the documentation - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ranking+Issues+in+GreenHopper
for the line:
bq. By default the Resolve Issue Permission is used when identifying those users who can rank issue. You can change this to the Schedule Issue Permission if you wish.
fields.summary: Documentation - Ranking issues permission no longer bound to Resolve Issue permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We need to figure out the how, what and why of flagging scope change in the sprint report. 

We want to flag late additions and punted issues, but we probably also want to show issues which were re-estimated (either up or down).

COS: 
- Issues that were added to the Sprint and not completed should be highlighted in some way in the not completed section (since there was never a promise to do so) 
- Issues that were removed from the Sprint should be shown as not completed but highlighted as deliberately removed (a form of scope change that hopefully happened with agreement amongst the team) 
- Issues that had their estimate changed should have a note indicating what their original estimate was (whether or not they were completed)
fields.summary: Further enhance sprint report

fields.description:
Currently we count the number of sprints and then suggest a name like Sprint 7.

We should use a scheme where we parse the last sprint name for numbers and then bump that number.

This would lead to name generation like :

No previous sprint ===> Sprint 1

Sprint 1 ===> Sprint 2

Revenge of the Seth ==> Revenge of the Seth 2

Revenge of the Seth 2 ==> Revenge of the Seth 3

Revenge of the Seth 3 Next Generation ==> Revenge of the Seth 3 Next Generation 2



So rules

* if no previous sprint then Sprint 1
* if parsed a number up to a space then bump that number
* if cant parse number up to a space then called it "previous 2"
fields.summary: As a user I would like smarter sprint naming

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When using the rapidboard, I click an issue to bring up the side panel with the issue details.

I go to the description tab, and right click on a link in the description. This causes the edit box to appear and reshuffle all the text. The right click context menu still functions fine, it's just a little jarring, and I don't know if I've accidentally modified the issue description
fields.summary: Right clicking on a link in the issue description from the rapidboard causes the inline edit box to appear

- Invite the user to learn more via Atlassian University: "Hi, looks like you're new here, welcome! If you are new to GreenHopper or Agile approaches such as Scrum or Kanban head over to Atlassian University for an introduction."

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello team,
As per Support ticket GHS-4488:

{quote}
Hi Atlassian Support,

In the Rapid Board Kanban "Work" mode, when we move a story/parent that has sub-tasks through the workflow, we'd like to be able to have the option of moving the subtasks to the same workflow status, as long as the subtask workflow and parent workflows support that status.

Right now, when we move a story/parent to "In Progress", the subtasks just sit in the "Open" category.

Thanks,
Bob
{quote}

Please let us know the possibility of implementing this feature request.
Thanks,
fields.summary: Rapid Board - Allow Parent issues to move Subtasks along the workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello team,
As per Support ticket [GHS-4487|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4487]:

{quote}
Hi Atlassian Support,

It is a fantastic feature of GreenHopper to progress multiple issues through the workflow at the same time via the Planning Board.

This feature, however, is absent from the Rapid Board for Kanban.

This would make planning and moving issues much faster, especially after they are created in succession.
{quote}

Could you please take a look on this improvement and let us know if this is possible?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow Multi-Move of Issues on Kanban Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When viewing cycle time charts, weekends are included in the calculations. There should be an option to exclude weekends, if desired.

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if the user's timezone does not match the server timezone?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is this setting remembered between page views?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is it clearly specified when this option is on/off?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens to any events that happen in these excluded windows? Will they simply not be displayed/will they be calculated?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if there are large outliers in the excluded period? Will the chart adjust properly?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Add option to exclude weekends from cycle time calculations

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Raised on behalf of a customer.

To Do: It is showing all the ‘Open’ status issues
Done: It is showing all the ‘Closed’ issues
In Progress: Between Open and Closed issues.

!image001.png!

In reality, this is not a case. We could have Rapid Board columns mapped with different status, such as Open, Analysis, Development To Do, Development, Test Queue, Testing, Deploy, Done.

1) We must need GreenHopper Project Progress bar gadget to show the progress based on Rapid Board mapping

* Display by Swimlane order (this is ideal)
* or by Quick filter

2) As today, the project progress bar configured with context filter. Is it possible to change the order? For above example, I wanted to show the order;

* 01-Risk-SSS
* 02-Risk-Test
* 03-Risk-WWW     

Is it possible to change this order?
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster I would like the project progress gadget to support the Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently:
On the Task Board and Rapid Board, I can filter by assignee. But the assignee dropdown picker does not allow me to do a search or a type-ahead to quickly find the assignee. When the list of potential assignees is very long, it is cumbersome to select someone far down the list.

Demonstration of this:
http://www.screencast.com/t/bwB6WUy4

Desired:
Enable type-ahead or search in the dropdown picker so I can quickly select the assignee by which I want to filter.
fields.summary: As a Task Board user, I want the "filter by assignee" picker to be easier to use

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
GreenHopper appears to use a global exception handler that reacts to any uncaught exception by showing an error on the rapid board.

We've seen a couple of support requests from users with browser extensions that throw exceptions. In some cases, the errors may be benign and GreenHopper could continue to function normally, but the errors alarm people, and as a result they raise support requests.

This could potentially be caused by any JavaScript that runs within the context of the page: browser extensions, GreaseMonkey scripts, even JIRA plugins or Speakeasy extensions.
fields.summary: As a rapid board user with buggy browser extensions, I don't want exceptions thrown from extensions to break GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Why is the Agile Gadget modifying my Filter?

We are using a very simple filter to collect tasks for our Scrumteam:
labels = sprint-1217 ORDER BY priority DESC

But when using this filter in the Agile Gadget an additional filter is applied:
filter = SCRUM_NESX AND NOT fixVersion is EMPTY AND project in (AEBS etc...

As we have a lot of Issues and Task that don't have a Fix version set. These issues and tasks will be skipped in the chart. But we see them in the Rapid board.

We are using labels to pick up tasks from our backlog for each planned sprint and the label syntax is Group-YYWW, This method makes it possible for the team to plan work that we collect from a lot of different projects, a part of the teams work is to analyze and to set fixversions and time estimation.
fields.summary: Agile Gadget modifies filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The work mode offers the possibility to add swimlanes on a per-user basis - this allows us to easily see who's buried in work and who's twiddling their thumbs, waiting for stuff to do.

The plan mode however does not allow us to group things like that. Theres the fancy Sprint bar that allows us to add issues to the next sprint, but we don't know if the added issues (lets say, 40 in total) are distributed evenly (about 4 per dev, with 10 devs) unless we actually start the sprint and switch to the plan mode.

Right now, we use the Planning Board (not the Rapid Board) in Assignee View to pick issues and assign them to a Release Version (<product version>.<sprint>, like 6.0.0.5 for the 5th sprint of version 6.0.0), trying to achieve an evenly distributed work load for each user.
Then we switch to the Rapid Board, define a Quick Filter for that particular version (again, 6.0.0.5 for the example) and apply it to the Plan Mode. 
From there, its the same as just adding issues to a new sprint - but I guess the Plan Mode could do a lot better than that ;)
fields.summary: Add grouping/swimlanes/assignee summary to Plan Mode

fields.description:
Just looks like nothing is happening. 

Here is the steps to reproduce the issue: 
# Give the user all permission in the project except "Schedule Issues" or "Assign Issues"
# Clear the browser cache. 
# Login in JIRA 
# Create a KANBAN board for the project.
# Try to reorder the issue. 

Here is the KB article with more details : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Issue+ranking+not+working
fields.summary: No warning if you try to rank but have no permissions in Work mode
